sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A nevv vvonder, a woman never vext A pleasant conceited comedy: sundry times acted: never before printed. Written by VVilliam Rowley, one of his Maiesties servants. Rowley, William, 1585?-1642?
[2], 81, [1] p.
Imprinted by G[eorge] P[urslowe] for Francis Constable, and are to be sold at his shop at the signe of the Crane in Saint Pauls Churchyard, London : 1632.
In verse. Printer's name from STC. With a tail-piece on L2r. Variant: lacking tail-piece. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

[2], 81, [1] p.
Imprinted by G[eorge] P[urslowe] for Francis Constable, and are to be sold at his shop at the signe of the Crane in Saint Pauls Churchyard, London : 1632.
In verse. Printer's name from STC. With a tail-piece on L2r. Variant: lacking tail-piece. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

G[eorge] P[urslowe]
